intro: Henriettea elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic henriettea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, elliptical leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Henriettea elliptica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
